dt: {bc}to promote the interests or cause of
{bc}to uphold or defend as valid or right {bc}{sx|advocate||}
{bc}to bid in bridge so as to show support for
{bc}to provide a basis for the existence or subsistence of
{bc}to hold up or serve as a foundation or prop for
{bc}to maintain (a price) at a desired level by purchases or loans
{bc}to maintain the price of by purchases or loans
{bc}to keep from fainting, yielding, or losing courage {bc}{sx|comfort||}

pt: {sc}support{/sc} {sc}uphold{/sc} {sc}advocate{/sc} {sc}back{/sc} {sc}champion{/sc} mean to favor actively one that meets opposition. {sc}support{/sc} is least explicit about the nature of the assistance given.
{sc}uphold{/sc} implies extended support given to something attacked.

pt.t: {it}upheld{/it} the legitimacy of the military action

pt: {sc}back{/sc} suggests supporting by lending assistance to one failing or falling.

pt.t: refusing to {it}back{/it} the call for sanctions

pt: {sc}champion{/sc} suggests publicly defending one unjustly attacked or too weak to advocate his or her own cause.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}supporter{/it}, from Late Latin {it}supportare{/it}, from Latin, to transport, from {it}sub-{/it} + {it}portare{/it} to carry {ma}{mat|fare|}{/ma}
shortdef: to endure bravely or quietly : bear
to promote the interests or cause of
to uphold or defend as valid or right : advocate
